meanings.definition: To kill or offer as a sacrifice, especially by burning.
meanings.sent1: The ancient tribe immolated animals to please their gods.
meanings.sent2: The witch immolated the cursed object in the fire.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally immolated the dish, turning it into a charred mess.
meanings.sent4: The dragon's fiery breath immolated everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The bonfire immolated the old wooden furniture, sending sparks into the night sky.

meanings.definition: To destroy or kill by fire.
meanings.sent1: The wildfire immolated the entire forest, leaving only ashes behind.
meanings.sent2: The arsonist planned to immolate the evidence of his crime.
meanings.sent3: The careless camper nearly immolated himself when his tent caught fire.
meanings.sent4: The explosion immolated the building, sending debris flying in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The volcanic eruption immolated the village, burying it under molten lava.
